noice for parkour and quick escape
I'd personally make it unaffected by Looting, so that Java players won't hold a sword in their off-hand and expect more emeralds. Maybe increase the max level to Money Fork II?

The part about making it unaffected by looting is quite reasonable. Should probably be a feature, as well. Though, it should remain as a single level enchantment. If the the procent-vise cap is raised, you can very easily get your hands on emeralds (they should still be somewhat hard to acquire). Just imagine going out hunting fish with it. It'd be broken at that point!
You should be able to get it on a sword and axe too.
The warped forest has no correlation to soul fire, so this should be grown in the soul sand valley on soul soil.
A Netherite watering can? Just use bonemeal, which is in abundance, or patience, which appears to not be.
You can use bonemeal which is extremely easy to get. All you need is bones or a composter from a village (or you can craft one).
I love that idea! I like to have indoor gardens, but you don't just make a hole in the ceiling, or put a river in your house. Also, watering cans would be very useful.

Instead:

A watering can being craftable from iron that would allow manual watering of farmland without the need of other water sources.

I would suggest a Copper Watering Can. It would be nice to have some copper tools that can only be made from copper.

A Copper Watering Can could water farm plans as suggested but also quickly convert dirt blocks to mud blocks.
More uses for netherite, but they would have to add diamond variants of these tools to keep consistency. Good idea, but unlikely in my opinion.
398341553831 maybe they could be in a chest inside one of those obsidian things in the big house thingy that's rare to find
There is elytra already, but maybe a more rare elytra that has better stats than the current elytra could be added.

This would be so cool for building, and you can see something similar in Minecraft: Dungeons. We've got snow layers, why not dirt, sand, and gravel?
They could naturally spawn and also spawn during SAND AND MUD STORMS.
I want this in the game

Dirt, grass_block, sand and gravel. These are the only blocks that I think would need it. As a builder and terraformer it would be amazing to have that and be able to do even more beautiful things.
I just rewatched the 2020 archaeology trailer, and already in that trailer you could see the blocks mentioned having "break down" phases in layers.

And to make these blocks even more incredible, it would be great to have plants like flowers, grasses... Etc could be placed on any layer.
One layer of gravel may have the decoration function in forests (rarely) and sand can be created by sandstorms in desert (when storms in other places). Mud layers i dont see any function.

I didn't expect someone else to post this after I had deleted my own version recently, but it's good to know that there are people that agree with the concept.

I've personally always pushed that it should be decided by a formula like  X / ( [X-1] + CraftingCost) = %Repaired

Low X values means a lower repair rate, and high values means greater, but shovels always get exactly 100% this way.

Anything less than 1 would be untenable, because 1 would be equal to the efficiency of crafting a new item to combine.

1.5 would mean 1 material repairs 60% of a sword and 17.6% of a chestplate.

3 would mean that 1 material repairs 75% of a sword and 30% of a chestplate.

_

Mojang really needs to get on this. The Anvil's repair function was ill conceived from the beginning, and has gone unchanged for years.

As you mentioned, Mending is also an issue because of how easy it's become to obtain through exploits, even though it's supposed to be rare.

Well, you keep the enchantments if you mend stuff with an anvil.

But I still agree, mending is sooooooo easy to get if you AFK fish or just make a villager breeder.
You already get XP from mining.
I like this idea it would give you the most XP out of all the ores
Can you get it from the creative inventory?

Great idea bro. This would add so much to the game and it could even be a new villager workstation! i propose that adding a redstone block gives players a radiation effect or makes it nuclear, and adding a rabbits foot would give the explosion a significant knock back effect. Also, I think that you should have to first make the explosive and then you should add to it. By this I mean that instead of crafting an explosive with 1 TNT 3 gunpowder 1 glowstone 1 fire charge etc.. that you should first make an explosive out of the TNT and gun powder and then add to it.

Another idea: that this table works the same to make fireworks easier and that it has its own recipe book, but the interface is a bit strange so it would be good if it was like a rocket and above type: "gunpowder" below "compound or ball of fireworks" and below "paper or material from the making of tnt"
This would have insane potential.
If only I could give more votes! A simple grid pattern with black bars would be perfect.

One way of implementing waystones is by having them be two different blocks, the main one being the waystone gate, and the secondary one being the waystone terminal. A gate is an end game item powered by placing above a beacon. The gate can teleport players to closeby terminals or far away gates.

Another way of powering the waystone would be with a type of amethyst placed in the waystone interface. Waystones can teleport based on what stage the amethyst is in. The higher the concentration of amethyst placed, the further the player can travel. For example, 500 blocks per stage of amethyst.

This could work, but I'm not seeing it. The nether is extremely hot. This suggested biome is cold. If there were clues put in that some freak accident or mutation of sorts happened to make this small area cold rather than intensely hot, I'd buy it and it'd even be really cool (no pun intended). I can't see any other way of this working though.

This plant is a species related to the Weeping Vines and Chorus Plants which evolved so it can survive in the cold Polar Chasm of the hot Nether dimension. Also, if you voted for this plant, you should vote for the biome it would spawn in; the Polar Chasm.

Jigglypuff. There are two reasons why the Polar Chasm is a cold biome in a hot dimension 

One. The biome only spawns ether at very high or very low altitudes. This is a reference to the equator’s temperature. The further you get away from it, the colder the temperature becomes.
Two. There is a large amount of Cryooze. A deadly version of Liquid Nitrogen that glows like blue ice, but feels like dense water. Most of the biome’s residents are immune to it though.
this would be good, it would be a matching wood type with birch
That would invalidate netherite being related to the nether.
I mean, diamond is from the Overworld but you don’t see that being a problem.
The end cities had to be made by SOMEONE, who's to say that they never got to the nether?
What if you turn into a zombie or another undead mob after consumption? Then you could get a game over screen and have the chat say something like, "[Player] turned into a zombie" lol.
Isn't it already confirmed they became zombified from being in the Overworld too long though
Cursed crying obsidian / Nightmare obsidian?
Interesting, how would you craft it. And maybe you could dye the crying obsidian to get different effects.

I'm in the middle of suggesting the ability to dye crying obsidian, which I think would also be a suitable replacement for glowing obsidian. (If you didn't already notice, crying obsidian glows-- so I guess that it's already glowing obsidian?)

Here's my take.

 

Bleeding Obsidian technically already exists in real life. It forms as Obsidian normally would, but there is a large amount of iron present when forming, giving it red accent.

If you create Obsidian (with lava and water) next to iron ore, there could be a 10% chance of getting Bleeding Obsidian instead of regular Obsidian. Iron Blocks could be 100%, and you could even get creative with blocks like Anvils and Blast Furnaces and the odds of getting Bleeding Obsidian can change with every item with iron in it.

Bleeding Obsidian probably wouldn't do much except be a really cool decorative block to compliment Obsidian and Crying Obsidian. It'd be a cool block for builders and mapmakers.
Crimson obsidian

I think this would be really great! Netherite door behaves same as iron door, need redstone to open, but is 100% blast resistant like obsidian or netherite blocks. So you can make a base that actually has an entrance but is also fully blast resistant. Maybe also add a netherite button/pressure plate that wont blow up either?

Also, the door should takes twice as long to break as netherite block, because this door takes up the space of two blocks. And only with netherite pickaxe. Texture would just be like a darker iron door, like the color of netherite ingot vs iron ingot. 

As far as obtaining, maybe this could generate somewhere in the bastions? Maybe its a bit late for that though haha.

I think its fine if its a bit expensive, so maybe 6 netherite ingots in the crafting table makes 3 netherite doors (just like 6 iron ingots makes 3 iron doors) or 1 iron door in smithing table with 1 netherite ingot makes one netherite door.

Please keep posting more stuff for the nether update
